metadata.Title: CVE-2014-7810 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Expression Language (EL) implementation in Apache Tomcat 6.x before6.0.44, 7.x before 7.0.58, and 8.x before 8.0.16 does not properly considerthe possibility of an accessible interface implemented by an inaccessibleclass, which allows attackers to bypass a SecurityManager protectionmechanism via a web application that leverages use of incorrect privilegesduring EL evaluation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-7810` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libservlet2.4-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
libservlet2.5-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
libtomcat6-java - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6 - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-admin - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-common - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-examples - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-extras - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
tomcat6-user - 6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

libservlet3.0-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
libtomcat7-java - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7 - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-admin - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-common - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-examples - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
tomcat7-user - 7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tomcat6 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0.39-1ubuntu0.1').
tomcat7 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.0.52-1ubuntu0.3').
